Dandu, Northern Prov., Alt. 750 m., with mountain rising to 1100 m. Rainfall perhaps between 300 and 400 mm. with maxima in April and probably November. In 1952 the main rains started on 27th March. Rock red granite; soils: (a) a red sandy loam on well drained slopes, (b) pale sandy soil near watercourses, (c) a yellowish brown powdery soil on flats, (d) 'black cotton soil', glutinous, cracking, in areas of impeded drainage. A rich Commiphora-Acacia scrub with scattered larger trees such as Delonix, Terminalia, Gryocarpus.

Dandu, Northern Prov. Alt. 750 m., with mountain rising to 1100 m. Rainfall perhaps between 300 and 400 mm. with maxima in April and probably November. In 1952 the main rains started on 27th March. Rock red granite; soils:--(a) a red sandy loam on well drained slopes, (b) pale sandy soil near watercourses, (c) a yellowish brown powdery soil on flats, (d) 'black cotton soil', glutinous, cracking, in areas of impeded drainage. A rich Commiphora-Acacia scrub with scattered larger trees such as Delonix, Terminalia, Gyrocarpus. alt. 2700 ft. Shady spots on mt.

Ogaden.  The last rain fell on 7th Nov. After this the vegetation began to dry out. Leaf drop and autumn colours began about 21th Nov.  There were four types of habitat:-  1. Stony soil at foot of hills and on low hills about 30 m. high. Shrubs spread out to 10-18 m. apart, with poor ground vegetation.  2. Dense bush with trees up to 10 m. high; on sandy soil. Practically no collecting done in these areas.  3. Medium bush on red sandy soil. Shrubs up to 3 m. high were generally about 10 m. Rich ground vegetation.  4. Open bush on red sandy soil, with practically no shrubs - a few plants to 60 cm. high. Flooded during rains.
Mikumi National Park, north of Lodge; east of road; along seasonal stream

Sololo, Northern Prov., Alt. 740 m. A plain with alternating red sandy loam, yellow-grey and black cotton soils and outlying mountains of escarpment (red igneous rocks) rising to 1350 m. Combretum, Ficus, etc.; on higher mountain, Dracaena and Coleus.

Moyale, Northern Prov. Lag Manzili valley c. 6 km. east of Moyale. alt. 2900 ft. Ficus etc. forest along watercourse, sandy deep shade. Alt. 1080 m. with heights of up to 1200 m. and down to c. 780 m. adjacent. Rainfall (av. of 31 years) 635 mm., with maxima in April and October. Escarpment edge with granites, gneisses and schists exposed; white or yellowish sandy or loamy soils. Montane scrub with Cussonia, Ficus, Acacia, Dichrostachys, Combretum, Commiphora, etc. largely degraded by cultivation, fuel cutting, etc.

Dandu, Northern Prov., alt. 2600 ft. Red sandy loam, and black cotton soil. Alt. 750 m., with mountain rising to 1100 m. Rainfall perhaps between 300 and 400 mm. with maxima in April and probably November. In 1952 the main rains started on 27th March. Rock red granite; soils (a) a red sandy loam on well drained slopes, (b) pale sandy soil near watercourses, (c) a yellowish brown powdery soil on flats, (d) 'black cotton soil', glutinous, cracking, in arcas of impeded drainage. A rich Commiphora-Acacia scrub with scattered larger trees such as Delonix, Terminalia, Gyrocarpus.

Furroli, Nothern Prov. Undulating lava plateau (c. 950 m.) Granite mountain to 1,890 m. with 'Halo' of red sandy loam around it. Rainfall of plain probably c. 250 mm., of mountain top more and in September cloud there every morning, unusually heavy rain on 26 August, 1952 had produced flowers out of season. Vegetation of lava plains transition to open desert, grass-desert shrublet formation; on sand and hills, Commiphora-Acacia scrub; on mountain slopes, dry montane scrub; on mountain top. Juniperus-Olea-Tarchonanthus, etc., scrub.

Dandu, alt. 2500 ft. Black cotton soil. Northern Prov. Alt. 750 m., with mountain rising to 1100 m. Rainfall perhaps between 300 and 400 mm. with maxima in April and probably November. A rich Commiphora-Acacia scrub with scattered larger trees such as Delonix, Terminalia, Gyrocarpus.

Agheremariam (east). Alt. 6500 ft. Tangle, rather moister than usual. This replaces No. 14433 in moister area to east and is replaced by 14665 in the still wetter areas. Agheremariam (Alghe), S. Ethiopia. Alt. 6200 ft. Grassland. Alt. 1750 - 2100 m. Dissected plateau; lavas, humus - rich forest soils and red loams where the forest is destroyed. Border between Combretum-Faurea etc. fire-swept tree-grassland to west and Podocarpus-Albizzia etc. evergreen forest to east, the latter mostly degraded by shifting cultn. Rainfall possibly c. 900 m., maximum in May, dry from Nov. - March.
